meanings.definition: The state of being full or filled to capacity.
meanings.sent1: The picnic basket's fullnesses delighted the hungry family.
meanings.sent2: The fullnesses of the water pitcher made it heavy to carry.
meanings.sent3: The fullnesses of the cookie jar tempted the children to sneak a treat.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed with the fullnesses of joy and contentment.
meanings.sent5: The fullnesses of the balloon made it ready to burst at any moment.

meanings.definition: The quality of being complete or whole.
meanings.sent1: The artist admired the fullnesses of the finished painting.
meanings.sent2: The fullnesses of the puzzle revealed a beautiful picture when completed.
meanings.sent3: The fullnesses of the story left no loose ends for the readers.
meanings.sent4: His heart swelled with the fullnesses of love for his family.
meanings.sent5: The fullnesses of the garden showcased nature's beauty in its entirety.

meanings.definition: The extent or degree to which something is full or complete.
meanings.sent1: The fullnesses of the glass determined how much more water could fit.
meanings.sent2: The fullnesses of the suitcase indicated it was packed to its limit.
meanings.sent3: The fullnesses of the traffic jam caused frustration among drivers.
meanings.sent4: The fullnesses of the schedule left no room for additional appointments.
meanings.sent5: The fullnesses of the library shelves displayed a wide range of books.
